thread.title: WWE superstar Rosa Mendes announces retirement
thread.title_full: WWE superstar Rosa Mendes announces retirement

author: Dave DeLuca (david.deluca@performgroup.com)
title: WWE superstar Rosa Mendes announces retirement
text:
February 13, 2017 9:04pm   9:04pm EST In a lengthy Instagram post, Mendes wrote about how the birth of her daughter, Jordan, has changed her hopes and dreams moving forward. Rosa Mendes (Getty Images) 
Updated at 9:04 p.m. ET 
Updated at 9:04 p.m. ET 
After a decade with WWE, superstar Rosa Mendes announced her retirement from the company Monday. 
In a lengthy Instagram post, Mendes wrote about how the birth of her daughter, Jordan, has changed her hopes and dreams moving forward. Mendes' announcement came on Jordan's first birthday. 
"As I write these words I have tears in my eyes because of the love I have for my WWE family, and especially for the WWE universe," Mendes wrote. "For the last 10 years, WWE was my life, my world and my family. I was [Mendes]. Now I am Milena Roucka, Jordan's mother, a soon to be wife and a hard-working entrepreneur. For years I have been fortunate to put smiles on people’s faces worldwide, performed for hundreds of thousands of fans and lived off of the adrenaline from the WWE audience.” 
MORE: Former WWE writer Bruce Prichard shares stories, insight on new podcast 
Mendes' last match was on WWE's European tour in April 2015. She had been out of action since then because of her pregnancy. 
She made her "Raw" debut on Dec. 29, 2008, and compiled a 10-111 record in her WWE career. 
Mendes' entire Instagram post is below. A photo posted by Rosa Mendes (@wwerosamendes) on Feb 13, 2017 at 10:01am PST Watch This
